requirements_document.feature_name: PubMed Literature Search and Summarization Agent
requirements_document.overview: An intelligent agent specialized in academic literature retrieval, filtering, and preliminary summarization from PubMed Central (PMC). The system accesses PMC open access articles through AWS S3, processes them intelligently, and generates structured reports based on user queries.
requirements_document.business_value: This agent significantly enhances research efficiency by automating literature search and summarization processes, reducing research preparation time from days to hours. It ensures comprehensive coverage of relevant literature with accurate citation information, providing researchers with a reliable and efficient tool for academic literature review.

included: PubMed Central open access articles retrieval via AWS S3
Impact factor sorting and priority filtering
Key information extraction (title, abstract, authors, journal, impact factor)
Complete citation information in multiple formats (APA, MLA)
Metadata extraction from PMC S3 data source
excluded: Full-text analysis beyond metadata and abstracts

functional_requirements.title: AWS S3 PMC Data Integration
functional_requirements.user_story: As a researcher, I want the agent to access PubMed Central data via AWS S3, so that I can retrieve the most comprehensive and up-to-date open access articles.
acceptance_criteria: WHEN the agent is initialized THEN it should establish connection to the PMC S3 bucket (arn:aws:s3:::pmc-oa-opendata)
WHEN accessing PMC data THEN the agent should use no-sign-request method
WHEN retrieving files THEN the agent should be able to access all directories (oa_comm/, oa_noncomm/, phe_timebound/)
WHEN processing articles THEN the agent should handle both txt/ and xml/ formats
assumptions: PMC S3 bucket structure remains stable

functional_requirements.title: Keyword-based Literature Search
functional_requirements.user_story: As a researcher, I want to search for literature using keywords and topics, so that I can find relevant articles for my research.
acceptance_criteria: WHEN I input search keywords THEN the agent should return a list of relevant articles
WHEN searching by topic THEN the agent should identify related subtopics and keywords
WHEN multiple keywords are provided THEN the agent should support boolean operators (AND, OR, NOT)
WHEN search results are returned THEN they should be ranked by relevance
assumptions: PMC metadata includes keywords and topics

functional_requirements.title: Time Range Filtering
functional_requirements.user_story: As a researcher, I want to filter articles by publication date, so that I can focus on recent research.
acceptance_criteria: WHEN no time range is specified THEN the agent should default to the past 10 years
WHEN a custom time range is provided THEN the agent should filter articles accordingly
WHEN filtering by time THEN the agent should use publication date from metadata
WHEN displaying results THEN the agent should show the publication date for each article
assumptions: Publication dates are consistently available in metadata

functional_requirements.title: Impact Factor and Journal Quality Filtering
functional_requirements.user_story: As a researcher, I want to filter articles by journal impact factor and quality, so that I can focus on high-quality research.
acceptance_criteria: WHEN filtering by impact factor THEN the agent should support minimum threshold specification
WHEN sorting results THEN the agent should offer impact factor as a sorting option
WHEN journal quality is prioritized THEN the agent should consider additional metrics beyond impact factor
WHEN filtering by journal type THEN the agent should distinguish between OA and non-OA journals
assumptions: Impact factor data is available or can be integrated

functional_requirements.title: Multi-language Support
functional_requirements.user_story: As an international researcher, I want the agent to process both English and Chinese literature, so that I can access research in multiple languages.
acceptance_criteria: WHEN searching literature THEN the agent should accept keywords in both English and Chinese
WHEN processing Chinese articles THEN the agent should correctly extract metadata
WHEN generating reports THEN the agent should maintain original language integrity
WHEN translating key information THEN the agent should provide accurate translations
assumptions: PMC contains sufficient Chinese language articles

functional_requirements.title: Relevance-based Ranking Algorithm
functional_requirements.user_story: As a researcher, I want search results ranked by relevance to my query, so that I can quickly find the most pertinent articles.
acceptance_criteria: WHEN ranking articles THEN the agent should consider keyword frequency and position
WHEN calculating relevance THEN the agent should use a multi-dimensional scoring system
WHEN displaying results THEN the agent should show relevance scores
WHEN refining search THEN the agent should allow feedback to improve relevance
assumptions: Text content is available for relevance analysis

functional_requirements.title: Batch Literature Processing
functional_requirements.user_story: As a researcher, I want to process multiple articles simultaneously, so that I can efficiently analyze large sets of literature.
acceptance_criteria: WHEN batch processing is requested THEN the agent should handle at least 100 articles simultaneously
WHEN processing in batch THEN the agent should maintain processing quality
WHEN batch processing completes THEN the agent should provide a summary report
WHEN errors occur during batch processing THEN the agent should continue with remaining articles

functional_requirements.title: Key Information Extraction
functional_requirements.user_story: As a researcher, I want the agent to extract key information from articles, so that I can quickly understand their content without reading the full text.
acceptance_criteria: WHEN processing an article THEN the agent should extract title, abstract, authors, journal, and impact factor
WHEN extracting information THEN the agent should maintain accuracy and completeness
WHEN information is missing THEN the agent should note the gaps
WHEN presenting extracted information THEN the agent should use a structured format
assumptions: Key information is consistently available in metadata or text

functional_requirements.title: Structured Literature Review Report Generation
functional_requirements.user_story: As a researcher, I want the agent to generate structured literature review reports, so that I can efficiently review and cite relevant research.
acceptance_criteria: WHEN generating a report THEN the agent should include all key information
WHEN structuring the report THEN the agent should organize by relevance, date, or impact factor
WHEN creating reports THEN the agent should include citation information
WHEN a report is complete THEN the agent should provide it in a downloadable format
assumptions: Extracted information is sufficient for meaningful reports

functional_requirements.title: Citation Format Support
functional_requirements.user_story: As a researcher, I want citations in multiple formats, so that I can easily use them in my publications.
acceptance_criteria: WHEN generating citations THEN the agent should support APA format
WHEN generating citations THEN the agent should support MLA format
WHEN generating citations THEN the agent should support other common academic formats
WHEN creating a citation THEN the agent should ensure all required information is included
assumptions: Citation information is available in metadata

functional_requirements.title: Retraction Status Checking
functional_requirements.user_story: As a researcher, I want to know if articles have been retracted, so that I can avoid citing invalid research.
acceptance_criteria: WHEN processing an article THEN the agent should check for retraction status
WHEN an article is retracted THEN the agent should clearly mark it as such
WHEN displaying search results THEN retracted articles should be visually distinct
WHEN generating reports THEN retracted articles should be excluded by default
assumptions: Retraction information is available in metadata

performance: The agent should process search queries within 30 seconds
Batch processing of 100 articles should complete within 10 minutes
The system should handle at least 10 concurrent users
security: The agent should use no-sign-request method for AWS S3 access
User search queries should not be stored permanently
The system should comply with academic data usage policies
usability: The agent should provide clear error messages for failed searches
Search syntax should be intuitive and well-documented
Reports should be formatted for easy readability
reliability: The system should gracefully handle PMC S3 access failures
Regular updates should ensure compatibility with PMC data structure changes

constraints: The agent must access PMC data exclusively through the provided AWS S3 bucket
The system must operate within the limitations of the no-sign-request access method
The agent must respect PMC data usage policies and copyright restrictions
Processing capacity is limited by available computational resources
assumptions: PMC S3 bucket structure and access method will remain stable
Journal impact factor data can be obtained or integrated
PMC metadata is sufficiently structured for automated processing
Text and XML formats contain comparable information
success_criteria: The agent can successfully retrieve and process articles from PMC S3
Search results demonstrate high relevance to user queries
Generated reports contain accurate and complete information
Literature processing time is reduced by at least 70% compared to manual methods
Citation information is complete and correctly formatted

glossary.PMC: PubMed Central, a free digital repository of biomedical and life sciences journal literature
glossary.OA: Open Access, referring to research articles that are freely available
glossary.Impact Factor: A measure reflecting the yearly average number of citations to recent articles published in a journal
glossary.AWS S3: Amazon Web Services Simple Storage Service, a cloud storage service

analysis_notes: The PubMed Literature Search and Summarization Agent is evaluated as a single-agent system because its functionality, while comprehensive, follows a clear linear workflow from data retrieval to report generation. The agent's tasks are focused on a specific domain (PMC literature) with well-defined input/output relationships. While the system performs multiple functions (search, filter, rank, extract, report), these are closely related aspects of a unified literature processing pipeline rather than distinct specialized roles requiring multi-agent coordination. The data analysis agent type is recommended due to the system's focus on retrieving, processing, and analyzing structured data from the PMC repository. The key technical challenge lies in efficiently integrating with AWS S3 to access PMC data and implementing effective relevance ranking algorithms. The agent's value proposition centers on dramatically reducing literature review time while ensuring comprehensive coverage of relevant research.
